bodylog.files

Class Constant

  • java.lang.Object
    • bodylog.files.Constant

  • public class Constant
extends Object
    Static class for storing String values relating to file handling and DateTimeFormatters. Also contains the methods relating to the constants. *

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static File DATA_DIR
      The statistics folder which contains the folders of movements which contain their session files.
      static java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter FILE_DATE_FORMAT
      DateTimeFormatter for formatting dates into the form yyyy-mm-dd, suitable as file names as they'll be in chronological order.
      static String MOVE_END
      File ending for move files.
      static File MOVES_DIR
      The movements folder which contains the move files that store move data; variables and names.
      static String SESSION_END
      File ending for session files.
      static java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter UI_DATE_FORMAT
      DateTimeFormatter for formatting dates into the localized form, easier to read for a human.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean createDataFolder()
      Creates the data folder that holds the Move folders which contain their session files.
      static boolean createMovesFolder()
      Creates the movements folder that holds the Move defining move files.
      static String uiDateToFileDate(String dateString)
      Converts a string that is in the format used in the UI into the format used for the session files.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DATA_DIR

        public static final File DATA_DIR
        The statistics folder which contains the folders of movements which contain their session files.

      • MOVES_DIR

        public static final File MOVES_DIR
        The movements folder which contains the move files that store move data; variables and names.

      • SESSION_END

        public static final String SESSION_END
        File ending for session files.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOVE_END

        public static final String MOVE_END
        File ending for move files. Not .mov so it's not confused for a video file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FILE_DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter FILE_DATE_FORMAT
        DateTimeFormatter for formatting dates into the form yyyy-mm-dd, suitable as file names as they'll be in chronological order.

      • UI_DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter UI_DATE_FORMAT
        DateTimeFormatter for formatting dates into the localized form, easier to read for a human.

    • Method Detail

      • uiDateToFileDate

        public static String uiDateToFileDate(String dateString)
        Converts a string that is in the format used in the UI into the format used for the session files. Used in the UI class SessionEditor.
        Parameters:
        dateString - date string to be converted
        Returns:
        a date string in the local format
        See Also:
        SessionEditor

      • createMovesFolder

        public static boolean createMovesFolder()
                                 throws SecurityException
        Creates the movements folder that holds the Move defining move files.
        Returns:
        true if the folder exists after the operation, false otherwise
        Throws:
        SecurityException - when access is denied
        See Also:
        MOVES_DIR

      • createDataFolder

        public static boolean createDataFolder()
                                throws SecurityException
        Creates the data folder that holds the Move folders which contain their session files.
        Returns:
        true if the folder exists after the operation, false otherwise
        Throws:
        SecurityException - when access is denied
        See Also:
        DATA_DIR
